attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Further to my e - mail to Rt Hon Denham about a "time in lieu" substitute options to student loans, can I draw the P.M.'s attention to the following research and urge the British govt, to do more to help the gifted help themselves

"Opportunity for everyone, instead of opportunism in everything".

Young graduates hoping to get on the housing ladder have been warned that they faced a struggle. Half of university students expect to be able to buy their first home within five years of finishing their degrees, according to a survey.

But Endsleigh Financial Independent Tailoring, which commissioned the poll, warned that it would take seven years to save the deposit needed for a £190,000 home.

James Crocker, an independent financial adviser at the firm, said: "It seems highly unrealistic that a graduate with approximately £15,000 of debt will be able to save anywhere near enough for a deposit to buy a house within five years in the current mortgage market.
